results.title: Split-phase motor principles
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Ray-Bell Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Construction of stator and rotor; comparison of winding in two-phase stator with split-phase stator; effects of winding resistances and inductive reactances; and use of capacitor to produce phase displacement.

results.title: Splintered
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Peter Templeman, Stuart Parkyn and Ian Irvine
results.brief_description: A film about the unspoken rules of friendship… After leaving his best friend stranded at the scene of their crime, teenager Gavin struggles with the guilt of his actions and desperately tries to regain his mate’s trust.

results.title: Splendours of Britain
results.creator_credit: British Tourist Authority, Robert Angell and John Abbott
results.brief_description: An introduction to the heraldry and pageantry of Great Britain. Shows the work involved in creating a coat of arms; Salisbury Cathedral; the Queen and Knights of the Thistle attending a service at St. Giles; Trooping the Colours; scenes of country-side and cities.

results.title: Splendour in the grass
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description: Deanie (Natalie Wood) is a beautiful teenager eager to do what is right in her staunchly moral hometown, in the 1920’s but the emotions she shares with her boyfriend, Bud (Warren Beatty) are too strong to ignore. Eventually the conflict between what society expects and what their desires demand pushes Bud to physical collapse and Deanie to madness. The young stars bring freshness and intensity to this story of parental domination, moral codes and young love, directed with insight and power by Elia Kazan.

results.title: Splash [Italian version]
results.brief_description: A home swimming pool, an accidental drowning, a distraught helpless mother. Such tragedies can be prevented. A poolside seminar demonstrates the dangers and the means of avoiding them, emphasising the need for awareness and the knowledge of basic methods of resuscitation. In Italian language only.

results.title: Splash
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Buena Vista, Brian Grazer and Ron Howard
results.brief_description: A romantic comedy fairytale about a most unlikely liaison between a beautiful mermaid (Daryl Hannah) and a New York businessman, Allen Bauer (Tom Hanks). The two first meet when Allen (as a young boy) is rescued from drowning by the lovely mermaid, but it is many years later before the two are reunited on land in New York and our mermaid has transformed into Madison with legs in place of her fishy tail. Madison not only tries to hide her identity from Allen but she also has to keep her legs away from water - or her telltale fin will return. Added to this, Madison has also captured the interest of an obsessed scientist (Eugene Levy). Light-hearted entertainment with great support from John Candy as Allen’s brother Freddie Bauer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Touchstone Pictures, Buena Vista, Brian Grazer and Ron Howard

results.title: Spitfire over Australia
results.brief_description: During World War II, more than 650 Spitfire aircraft were delivered to the RAAF. This is the story of Colin Pay, who rebuilt one of those magnificent machines, a Vickers Supermarine Spitfire HF Mk VIII built in 1944, from the corroded hulk he acquired in 1982. It is now a superbly restored flying machine. Including some of the best air to air colour footage ever shot of a Spitfire in Australia, and archival footage of Spitfires in Darwin in 1943 and interviews with the pilots who originally flew them, this is the ideal video for avaition enthusiasts!
